definition: to feel embarrassed/to find it embarrassing/to be sorry (for inconveniencing sb)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: I am only ashamed of his asking so little.
sentences.chinese: 他要得这么少，我倒觉得不好意思呢。

sentences.english: This praise and confidence smote Dobbin's heart very keenly.
sentences.chinese: 这样的夸奖和信赖弄得都宾十分不好意思。

sentences.english: I'm afraid we only have distilled water. Is that all right?
sentences.chinese: 不好意思我们这只有蒸馏水，可以吗？

sentences.english: I thought he said he was shy about singing?
sentences.chinese: 我还以为他说他不好意思一展歌喉呢。

sentences.english: Excuse me while I pack for California.
sentences.chinese: 我要整理行装前往加利福尼亚，不好意思就此打住。

sentences.english: Timmy Tapper: Oh, sorry. Can I just say one more thing?
sentences.chinese: 哦，不好意思。我能再说几句话吗？

sentences.english: Oh, sorry. Where are our seats?
sentences.chinese: 唉呀，不好意思。我们的位子在哪啊？

sentences.english: No, I'm sorry, the value of a broken card cannot be refunded.
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，破损卡的工本费就不能退了。

sentences.english: I'm afraid we have no record of a reservation under this name.
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，恐怕我们没有这个名字记实的预订。

sentences.english: Excuse me, but I think you've overcharged me.
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，但我想你多算钱了。

sentences.english: I'm sorry. I saw him first.
Mrs. Derrick had asked him to go for the mail at Bonneville, and he had not been able to refuse.
sentences.chinese: 台力克太太拖他上波恩维尔去拿信，他不好意思推却。

sentences.english: I want to get up early tomorrow, bed, I sleep for, sorry.
sentences.chinese: 明天我要起早床，所以我先睡的，不好意思。

sentences.english: Im sorry, I didn t catch your name. Paul, was it?
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，我没听清楚你的名字。“保罗”是吗？

sentences.english: Can I have the value of the card refunded?
sentences.chinese: 不好意思，破损卡的工本费就不能退了。

definition: to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to blush/to redden (with shame, indignation etc)
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
